oai_dc:dc.dc:title: On the power of Bio-Turing machines
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: RAMESH, H
KRISHNA, SN
RAMA, R
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: p-systems
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this paper, we continue the study of Bio-Turing machines introduced in [1]. It was proved in [1] that using two differentiated cells, and using antiport rules of weight 2, one can recognize the family IRE. We show here that with just one differentiated cell, IRE can be characterized, by using antiport rules of weight 2, or by using symport rules of weight 3. We also prove that RE can be characterized using arbitrary alphabets, using 2 differentiated cells, and antiport rules of weight 2. Finally, we examine the computational power when there are no differentiated cells and show that non-regular languages can be accepted.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 5th International Conference on Unconventional Computation,York, ENGLAND,SEP 04-08, 2006
